title: Calculator question...
content:
Fairly dull question.. but why are most calculators right aligned?   
   
hmmm.
author: nic_mulvaney

comments.content:
If you only use whole numbers.   
   
These decimals align neither left nor right   
   
1345.19483   
12.1   
842   
   
suppose it's just best.

Most everyday practical applications deal with numbers larger than one, and non-integers can usually be rounded to a consistent number of places after the decimal point. The arithmetic in people's ledgers is right-aligned. Now, if we were talking about a calculator that displays all numbers in scientific notation, _that_ would be best left-aligned.
